tuv.seg: Electricity is generated in Ireland from a number of sources such as gas, coal, oil and renewable souces
Gineann roinnt foinsí leictreachas in Éirinn mar gás, gual, ola agus foinsí in-athnuaite
The standard electricity voltage in Ireland is 230V a.c., nominal, at 50Hz, with plugs being of the 3 pin IS411 (BS 1363) type
Is é an voltas caighdeánach leictreachais i bPoblacht na hÉireann ná 230V a.c., ainmniúil, ag 50Hz, agus úsáidtear plugaí trí phionna IS411 (BS 1363)
If you are moving to Ireland or coming to Ireland on holiday, you should check any electrical appliances you wish to bring with you in advance to ensure that you can use them in Ireland

Má tá tú ag bogadh go hÉirinn nó ag teacht go hÉirinn ar saoire, ba chóir duit aon ghairis leictreacha gur mian leat a thabhairt leat a sheiceáil roimh ré lena chinntiú gur féidir leat iad a úsáid in Éirinn
The Commission for Energy Regulation (CER) regulates the electricity market and can deal with unresolved complaints
Rialálann an Coimisiún um Rialáil Fuinnimh (CRF) an margadh leictreachais agus is féidir leis déileáil le gearáin neamhréitithe
Electricity services in Ireland are provided by the Electricity Supply Board (ESB), a state body that is owned and controlled by the Government
Soláthraíonn Bord Soláthair an Leictreachais (BSL) seirbhísí leictreachais i bPoblacht na hÉireann agus is comhlacht stáit leis an Rialtas é agus atá faoi smacht an Rialtais
ESB owns and manages the electricity network and operates 19 major power stations throughout Ireland and a number of smaller stations in 28 sites around the country
Is le BSL an gréasán leictreachais agus is é a bhainistíonn é agus a fheidhmíonn 19 mórstáisiún cumhachta ar fud na hÉireann chomh maith le roinnt stáisiún níos lú i 28 láithreán timpeall na tíre
Deregulation of the electricity market in Ireland
Dírialáil an mhargaidh leictreachais in Éirinn
In February 2000, as a result of EU directive 96/92/EC, the electricity market in Ireland was opened to competition
I mí Feabhra 2000, de thoradh threoir 96/92/CE an AE, osclaíodh an margadh leictreachais i bPoblacht na hÉireann d’iomaitheoirí
Larger customers using 4 gigawatt hours or more of power per year became free to choose their own electricity supplier
Bhí saoirse ansin ag custaiméirí ar mhórmhéid a úsáideann 4 uair an chloig gigeavata cumhachta nó níos mó a soláthraí leictreachais féin a roghnú
The retail electricity market opened fully to competition in February 2005
Osclaíodh an margadh leictreachais mhiondíola d’iomaitheoirí go hiomlán i mí Feabhra 2005
In November 2007 a Single Electricity Market (SEM) came into effect with the trading of wholesale electricity in Ireland and Northern Ireland on an all-island basis
I Samhain 2007 tháinig an Margadh Aonair Leictreachais i bhfeidhm agus bhí leictreachas mórdhíola i bPoblacht na hÉireann agus i dTuaisceart Éireann á thrádáil ar bhonn uile-oileánda
All business markets were deregulated from October 2010
Bhí dírialú gach margaí gnó ó Deireadh Fómhair 2010
From April 2011, the domestic market is deregulated with all suppliers free to set their own tariffs
Ó Aibreán 2011, is é an margadh baile dírialú le gach soláthraí saor in aisce a chur ar a gcuid táillí féin
Transmission and distribution of electricity
Leictreachas a tharchur agus a dháileadh

The electricity transmission system, commonly known as the national grid, is a high voltage network for the transmission of bulk electricity supplies from the electricity generation sources to transformer stations around Ireland

Is é atá sa chóras tarchuradóireachta leictreachais, ar a dtugtar an greille náisiúnta go coitianta, ná gréasán ardvoltais le mórsholáthairtí leictreachais a tharchur ó na foinsí ginte leictreachais chuig stáisiúin chlaochladáin timpeall na hÉireann
EirGrid, an independent state-owned body, is the transmission system operator and is responsible for the operation, development and maintenance of the system
Is é EirGrid, comhlacht neamhspleách ar leis an stát é, oibreoir an chórais tarchuradóireachta agus tá sé freagrach as an gcóras a oibriú, a fhorbairt agus a chothabháil
ESB Networks, a separate business unit within ESB, is the owner of the transmission system and is responsible for carrying out the maintenance and construction of the system
Is é ESB Networks, aonad gnó ar leithligh laistigh de BSL, úinéir an chórais tarchuradóireachta agus tá sé freagrach as obair chothabhála agus thógála a dhéanamh ar an gcóras

The distribution network is the medium and low voltage electricity network used to deliver electricity from the transformer stations to connection points such as houses, offices, shops, and street lights, and is owned by ESB Networks

Is é an gréasán dáileacháin an gréasán meánvoltais agus ísealvoltais a úsáidtear chun leictreachas a sheachadadh ó na stáisiúin chlaochladáin chuig pointí atá nasctha leo mar tithe, oifigí, siopaí, agus soilse sráide, agus is le ESB Networks é
ESB Networks is also the distribution system operator and is responsible for building, maintaining and operating all the distibution level network infrastructure
Is é ESB Networks oibreoir an chórais dáileacháin freisin agus tá sé freagrach as bonneagar uile an ghréasáin, ar leibhéal dáileacháin, a thógáil, a chothabháil agus a oibriú
This includes all overhead electricity lines, poles and underground cables
Tá gach líne leictreachais lasnairde, cuaille leictreachais agus cábla faoi thalamh san áireamh leis seo
ESB Networks has responsibility to all electricity customers, irrespective of their supplier, for:
Tá sé d’fhreagracht ar ESB Networks an méid seo a leanas a dhéanamh do gach custaiméir leictreachais, beag beann ar a soláthraí:
• Connection to the network
• Iad a nascadh leis an ngréasán
• Reading meters and passing these readings to the different supply companies
• Méadair a léamh agus iad a sheoladh ar aghaidh chuig na cuideachtaí difriúla soláthair
• Restoring supply in cases of interruptions and emergencies
• Soláthar a athbhunú i gcás go gcuirtear isteach air agus i gcás éigeandálacha
There are a number of electricity suppliers licenced by CER to supply electricity to retail customers
Tá roinnt soláthraithe leictreachais ann atá ceadaithe ag CRF le leictreachas a sholáthar do chustaiméirí miondíola
ESB Electic Ireland (formerly called ESB Customer Supply), an independent business unit within ESB, operates as the Public Electricity Supplier
Oibríonn BSL Éire Leictreach (ar a dtugtar Soláthar Custaiméirí BSL roimhe seo), aonad gnó neamhspleách laistigh de BSL, mar an Soláthraí Poiblí Leictreachais
Under this licence, ESB Electric Ireland is required among other things:
Faoin gceadúnas seo, ceanglaítear ar BSL Éire Leictreach an méid seo a leanas a dhéanamh i measc rudaí eile:
• To supply all customers who are not served by another supplier
• Leictreachas a sholáthar do gach custaiméir nach bhfreastalaíonn soláthraí eile orthu
• Not to discriminate in relation to supplying electricity
• Gan idirdhealú a dhéanamh i ndáil le leictreachas a sholáthar
• To purchase electricity in the most economic way
• Leictreachas a cheannach ar an mbealach is tíosaí is féidir
• To achieve certain performance targets set by CER
• Spriocanna feidhmíochta áirithe arna leagan síos ag CRF a bhaint amach
Services for customers with special needs
Seirbhísí do chustaiméirí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu
Three schemes are available for customers with special needs:
Tá trí scéim ar fáil do chustaiméirí a bhfuil riachtanais speisialta acu:
• An Electricity Allowance which you obtain as part of the Household Benefits Package
• Liúntas Leictreachais a fhaigheann tú mar chuid den Phacáiste Sochair Teaghlaigh
• Services for older people and people with disabilities
• Seirbhísí do dhaoine breacaosta agus do dhaoine le míchumais
• The medical register for customers with home medical equipment
• An clár liachta do chustaiméirí a bhfuil trealamh liachta baile acu
Some customers may be eligible for an Electricity Allowance
Féadfaidh roinnt custaiméirí a bheith incháilithe chun Liúntas Leictreachais a fháil
The Allowance is administered by the Department of Social Protection as part of the Household Benefits Package
Riarann an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí an Liúntas mar chuid den Phacáiste Sochair Teaghlaigh
The Department has a set of guidelines to determine who is eligible
Tá sraith treoirlínte ag an Roinn leis na daoine a bheidh incháilithe a chinneadh
Services for older people and people with disabilities
Seirbhísí do dhaoine breacaosta agus do dhaoine le míchumais
All suppliers of domestic customers are required to offer non-standard forms of communication to its customers
Ceanglaítear ar gach soláthraí seirbhíse do chustaiméirí baile foirmeacha cumarsáide neamhchaighdéanacha a thairiscint dá chustaiméirí
• Braille/talking and large-print bills for people with visual impairment
• Billí Braille/cainte agus mórchló do dhaoine a bhfuil lagú amhairc orthu
• Use of minicom or text phones for customers with hearing difficulties
• Úsáid fón minicom nó téacs do chustaiméirí a bhfuil deacrachtaí éisteachta acu
To avail of any of these, customers must register with the industry's Special Services Register
Chun ceann ar bith díobh seo a úsáid, caithfidh custaiméirí clárú le Clár Seirbhísí Speisialta an tionscail
Application forms are available from your electricity supplier
Tá foirmeacha iarratais ar fáil ó do sholáthraí leictreachais
The information you supply is also passed on to ESB Networks so it is aware of your need when contacting or visiting you
Cuirtear an t-eolas a thugann tú ar aghaidh chuig ESB Networks freisin ionas go mbíonn sé ar an eolas faoi do riachtanas nuair a dhéanann sé teagmháil leat nó nuair a thugann sé cuairt ort
Suppliers are also required to ensure that elderly customers who are registered with them are not cut off in the winter months (November - March) if they run into payment difficulties
Ceanglaítear ar sholáthraithe a chinntiú freisin nach ngearrtar an tseirbhís ar chustaiméirí scothaosta le linn mhíonna an gheimhridh (Samhain - Márta) má bhíonn deacrachtaí acu billí a íoc
Medical register for customers with home medical equipment
Clár liachta do chustaiméirí a bhfuil trealamh liachta baile acu

A Priority Register exists for customers who depend on electrically powered equipment such as home dialysis machines, oxygen concentrators or artificial ventilators If you are on the register you are contacted in advance of a planned disruption in supply or as soon as an unplanned outage is discovered

Tá Clár Tosaíochta ann do chustaiméirí a bhíonn ag brath ar threalamh faoi thiomáint leictreachais amhail innill scagdhealaithe baile, comhchruinnitheoirí ocsaigine nó aerálaithe saorga. Má bhíonn tú ar an gclár déantar teagmháil leat sula gcuirfear isteach ar an soláthar má bhíonn a leithéid pleanáilte nó a luaithe is a fhaightear amach faoi bhriseadh neamhphleanáilte
Also, suppliers cannot request that you be cut off over payment issues
Freisin, ní féidir le soláthraithe iarraidh go ngearrfar an tseirbhís ort mar gheall ar cheisteanna íocaíochta
Application forms for the Priority Register are available from your supplier
Tá foirmeacha iarratais don Chlár Tosaíochta ar fáil ó do sholáthraí
Suppliers are required to have codes of practice that protect customers. These cover such areas as: • Billing
Ceanglaítear ar sholáthraithe cóid chleachtais a bheith acu lena dtugtar cosaint do chustaiméirí
Suppliers are also required to produce Customer Charters with guaranteed service levels for their customers
Clúdaítear réimsí mar billeáil, gearáin agus margaíocht sna cairteacha
If you have a complaint you should contact your electricity supplier or ESB Networks as appropriate
Má bhíonn gearán agat ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le do sholáthraí leictreachais nó le ESB Networks de réir mar is cuí
ESB Networks deals with complaints about faulty meters, connection costs, emergencies, planned outages and delays in getting connected
Pléann ESB Networks le gearáin faoi mhéadair lochtacha, faoi chostais le nasc a fháil, éigeandálacha, faoi bhriseadh pleanáilte agus moilleanna maidir le nasc a fháil
Complain to your supplier if it is to do with changing supplier, closing your account (including when moving house) or costs included on your bill

Déan gearán le do sholáthraí má bhaineann sé le ceist ó thaobh do sholáthraí a athrú, do chuntas a dhúnadh (i gcás tú a bheith ag bogadh chuig seoladh nua chomh maith) nó costais a cuireadh san áireamh ar do bhille
Advice on making a complaint is available on the Commission for Energy Regulation's website
Tá comhairle maidir le gearán a dhéanamh ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Choimisiúin um Rialáil Fuinnimh
If you are unable to resolve your complaint with your supplier or with ESB Networks you can complain to the Regulator
Mura mbíonn tú in ann do ghearán a réiteach le do sholáthraí nó le ESB Networks is féidir leat do ghearán a thabhairt chuig an Rialtóir

Except in cases where there is a special agreement to the contrary, the amount of electricity supplied to your home will be measured by a meter or meters and other apparatus supplied and installed by ESB Networks

Seachas cásanna ina bhfuil comhaontú speisialta malartach i gceist, déanfar an méid leictreachais a sholáthraítear do do theach a thomhas le méadar nó méadair agus fearas eile arna sholáthar agus arna shuiteáil ag ESB Networks
This equipment remains the property of ESB Networks
Is le ESB Networks an trealamh seo i gcónaí
Only people authorised by ESB Networks are allowed to fix, connect, remove or work upon any meter, main fusebox, seal, electric line or other apparatus belonging to ESB Networks

Ní cheadaítear ach do dhaoine arna n-údarú ag ESB Networks oibriú ar aon mhéadar, aon bhosca fiúsanna, séal, líne leictreachais nó ar aon fhearas eile ar le ESB Networks é nó iad a dheisiú, a nascadh nó a bhaint amach

In the event of unauthorised interference, (whether by the customer or otherwise), the ESB reserves the right to estimate the unrecorded consumption and to include the charges for the unrecorded consumption in the customer's account

I gcás go gcuireann duine isteach ar na nithe seo gan údarú, (cibé an custaiméir nó duine eile atá ann), coimeádann BSL an ceart aige féin an leictreachas neamhthaifeadta a úsáideadh a mheas agus na táillí don úsáid neamhthaifeadta a chur san áireamh i gcuntas an chustaiméara
Electricity bills are issued every two months and are based on meter readings or estimations of electricity consumption
Eisítear billí leictreachais gach dhá mhí agus bíonn siad bunaithe ar léamh méadar nó ar mheastacháin faoin leictreachas a úsáideadh
Readings can be actual readings obtained by the meter reader or readings submitted by the customer
Maidir leis an léamh sin, is féidir é a fháil ach an méadar féin a léamh nó is féidir leis an gcustaiméir an léamh a chur isteach
An ESB Networks meter reader calls to your home to read the meter four times a year
Tugann léitheoir méadair ó ESB Networks cuairt ar do theach chun an méadar a léamh ceithre huaire in aghaidh na bliana

When the meter reader fails to gain access to read the meter, he or she leaves a card inviting you to submit your meter reading online or to dial in the reading to a special number CallSave 1850 337 777

Nuair a theipeann ar léitheoir an mhéadair teacht isteach chun an méadar a léamh, fágann sé nó sí cárta ag tabhairt cuireadh duit an léamh méadar a chur isteach tríd an láithreán gréasáin nó an léamh a thabhairt trí uimhir speisialta Saorghlao a dhiailiú 1850 337 777
(This is an Interactive Voice Response System that is available 24 hours every day.) If a reading is not received within 48 hours, an estimated bill is issued
(Córas Idirghníomhach Freagartha Gutha is ea é seo a bhíonn ar fáil 24 uair an chloig in aghaidh an lae). Mura bhfaightear léamh faoi cheann 48 uair an chloig, eisítear bille measta
Find advice on reading your meter here
Faigh comhairle maidir le do mhéadar a léamh anseo
Your supplier is required to include a standard set of information on your bill
Ceanglaítear ar do sholáthraí eolas caighdeánach a chur san áireamh le do bhille
This includes the meter reading upon which the bill is based, the tariff category that applies and any levies that are being applied to the bill
San áireamh leis seo, tá an léamh méadar ar a bhfuil an bille bunaithe, catagóir na taraife atá i gceist agus aon tobhaigh atá á bhfeidhmiú i leith an bhille
You can read more about the information supplied on bills here
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoin eolas a sholáthraítear ar bhillí anseo
Suppliers are required to offer a range of options to customers for paying their bills
Ceanglaítear ar sholáthraithe raon roghanna a thairiscint do chustaiméirí maidir lena mbillí a íoc
You should contact you supplier to find out what option suits you
Ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil le do sholáthraí chun an rogha a oireann duit a fháil amach
Electricity tariffs for domestic customers
Taraifí leictreachais do chustaiméirí baile
The Commission for Energy Regulation previously regulated ESB Electic Ireland's (formerly called ESB Customer Supply) tariffs
An Coimisiún um Rialáil Fuinnimh rialáilte taraifí BSL Éire Leitreach (ar a dtugtar Soláthar Custaiméirí BSL) roimhe seo
Since April 2011, ESB Electic Ireland, like the other suppliers, is free to set its own tariffs
Ó Aibreán 2011, tá BSL Éire Leitreach, cosúil leis na soláthraithe eile, saor in aisce a shocrú a taraifí féin
The Commission for Energy Regulation also regulates the charges associated with the electricity transmission and distribution networks
Rialálann sé na táillí a bhaineann leis na gréasáin tarchuradóireachta agus dáileacháin leictreachais freisin
The tariffs include the cost of generating electricity, transmitting it through the electricity network, distributing and supplying to end customers

Tá an costas le leictreachas a ghiniúint san áireamh leis na taraifí, chomh maith leis an gcostas lena tharchur tríd an ngréasán leictreachais, é a dháileadh agus a sholáthar do chustaiméirí ar deireadh
To set up a new connection if you are moving into a house/apartment in a new housing/apartment scheme, you will need to apply to an electricity supplier for a domestic supply agreement
Chun nasc nua a bhunú má bhíonn tú ag bogadh isteach i dteach/árasán i scéim nua tithíochta/árasán, beidh ort comhaontú soláthair baile a iarraidh ar sholáthraí leictreachais
You should contact ESB Networks and supply them with the following information:
Ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le ESB Networks agus an t-eolas seo a leanas a sholáthar dóibh:
• Your name and contact details
• D’ainm agus do shonraí teagmhála
• The Meter Point Reference Number (MPRN) for your new home (available from the builder/developer)
• Uimhir Thagartha Phointe an Mhéadair (UTPM) do do theach/árasán nua (ar fáil ón tógálaí/ón bhforbróir)
• The address of your home as defined at the planning stage (available from the builder/develpoer)
• Seoladh do thí/árasáin faoi mar a sainmhíníodh ag an gcéim phleanála (ar fáil ón tógálaí/ón bhforbróir)
ESB Networks will complete the installation of your meter
Cuirfidh ESB Networks an obair i gcrích le do mhéadar a shuiteáil
The builder's electrician will switch on the electricity supply in your home
Cuirfidh leictreoir an tógálaí an soláthar leictreachais ar siúl i do theach/árasán
If you are building your own home you will need apply for a new connection to ESB Networks
Má tá do theach féin á thógáil agat beidh ort ar nasc nua le ESB Networks a iarraidh
When you are leaving an address, you should take the meter reading, contact your electricity supplier let them know you are moving and give the supplier your meter reading
Nuair atá tú ag imeacht ó do sheanseoladh, ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le do sholáthraí leictreachais agus tabhair an léamh méadar don soláthraí
If the house or apartment to which you are moving is new, you should contact your electricty supplier and ESB Networks as mentioned above
Más teach nó árasán nua an ceann a bhfuil tú ag bogadh chuige, ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le do sholáthraí leictreachais agus le ESB Networks mar a luadh thuas
If the house or apartment to which you are moving was previously occupied, you should take an ESB Meter Reading when you take over responsibility for the premises
Má bhí duine ina chónaí roimhe sa teach nó san árasán a bhfuil tú ag bogadh chuige, ba chóir duit Léamh Méadar BSL a ghlacadh nuair a ghlacann tú freagracht as an áitreabh
If the house has been disconnected for less than 2 years, you will need to apply to your supplier for a domestic supply agreement
Má bhí an teach dínasctha ar feadh tréimhse níos lú ná 2 bhliain, beidh ort comhaontú soláthair baile a iarraidh ar do sholáthraí
Your supplier will advise you about the reconnection process
Tabharfaidh do sholáthraí comhairle duit faoin bpróiseas leis an áitreabh a athnascadh
If the house has been disconnected for more than 6 months you will also have to get the wiring checked and certified before it can be reconnected
Má bhí an teach dínasctha le breis is 6 mhí beidh ort seiceáil agus deimhniú a fháil don sreangra sular féidir é a athnascadh
If the house has been disconnected for more than 2 years you will have to apply to ESB Networks for a new connection
Má bhí an teach dínasctha le breis is 2 bhliain beidh ort nasc nua a iarraidh ar ESB Networks
If you want to change supplier you should contact your new supplier with details of your meter number and a meter reading
Más mian leat chun soláthróir a athrú ba chóir duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le do sholáthraí nua le sonraí de d'uimhir méadair agus an méadar a léamh
You will be talked through the switching process by the supplier who will then process your application
Beidh an soláthraí labhairt leat tríd an bpróiseas a athrú agus beidh d'iarratas a phróiseáil ansin
More information on switching is available on the Regulator's website
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar athrú fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Rialtóra
Contact an electricity supplier or:
Déan teagmháil le soláthraí leictreachais nó:
South City Delivery Office
Oifig Seachadta Cathrach Theas
Locall:CallSave 1850 372 372
Lóghlao:CallSave 1850 372 372
New connections/voltage queries/metering, etc.: Tel: 1850 372 757
Naisc nua/fiosrúcháin faoi voltas/méadrú, srl.: Teil: 1850 372 757
Supply Failure/Emergencies (24 hour) Tel: 1850 372 999
Teip ar an Soláthar/Éigeandálacha (24 uair a chloig) Teil: 1850 372 999
Commission for Energy Regulation
Coimisiún um Rialáil Fuinnimh
